programme.title: Pinky Dinky Doo 41: The Two Daffinees/Hot Hot Hot
programme.desc: When Daffinee's cousin comes to visit, the two have a bubble-blowing competition that gets too competitive. Great Big Fancy word: Competitive; On a very hot day in Smack Dab Park, Pinky and her friends learn to be observant when they try to cool down with some Icy Fruity Fruit Fruits. Great Big Fancy word: Observe. (TVG) ().(n)

programme.title: The Electric Company 28: A Whole New Francine
programme.desc: Francine decides to be a nicer person, but is it just a ploy to get invited into The Electric Company? (TVG) ().(n)

programme.title: Treasure Buddies
programme.desc: Budderball, B-Dawg, Rosebud, Buddha and Mudbud--the mischievous mutts from "Santa Buddies"--undertake an epic treasure hunt in ancient Egypt in this fun-filled adventure. Starring Richard Riehle, Mason Cook, Adam Alexi-Malle, Mo Gallini, Christopher Maleki, Ranya Jabar, Anna Primiani and Edward Herrmann. Directed by Robert Vince; written by Robert Vince and Anna McRoberts.(n)

programme.title: Spymate
programme.desc: Move over James Bond! A high-flying secret agent primate named Minkey swings into action when a young inventor is kidnapped by an evil scientist in this family comedy from the producer of ''Air Bud.'' Starring Chris Potter, Emma Roberts, Richard Kind, Musetta Vander, Pat Morita and Debra Jo Rupp, Barry Bostwick. Directed by Robert Vince; screenplay by Anna McRoberts, Anne Vince and Robert Vince, story by Anna & Ed McRoberts.(n)

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: From the creators of 'Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit' comes this hilarious animated adventure set in the sewers of London. Flushed down the toilet by a nasty sewer rat, pampered pet mouse Roddy St. James lands in the squalor of the city's smelly underworld. But getting back to his high-society digs proves much tougher than anticipated thanks to a villainous amphibian named Toad who has it out for young Roddy and pretty rat Rita, who is helping him escape. Featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Ian McKellen, Jean Reno, Bill Nighy, Andy Serkis and Shane Richie. Directed by David Bowers, Sam Fell; story by Sam Fell and Peter Lord and Dick Clement & Ian La Frenais; screenplay by Dick Clement & Ian La Frenais and Chris Lloyd & Joe Keenan and Will Davies. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: "Storks" delivers big laughs in this riotous comedy that finds the gangly birds out of the baby business and into package delivery. When top delivery stork Junior accidentally turns on their old baby-making device, he produces a beautiful, bouncing baby girl...and a whole lot of trouble for himself and his human pal, Tulip. Featuring the voices of Andy Samberg, Katie Crown, Kelsey Grammer, Jennifer Aniston, Ty Burrell, Keegan-Michael Key, Jordan Peele and Danny Trejo. Directed by Nicholas Stoller & Doug Sweetland; written by Nicholas Stoller. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Snow Buddies
programme.desc: The adventurous puppies journey to the Arctic for a thrilling dogsled race in this second installment in the "Air Buddies" franchise. Starring Jimmy Bennett, Mike Dopud, John Kapelos, Whoopi Goldberg, Jim Belushi and Kris Kristofferson. Directed by Robert Vince; written by Robert Vince and Anna McRoberts.(n)

programme.title: Santa Buddies
programme.desc: It's a holiday adventure with the Buddies as the friendly mutts try to help Santa and his dog, Santa Paws, save the true spirit of Christmas from disappearing. Zachary Gordon, Josh Flitter, Tom Bosley and George Wendt head up the cast in this fourth film in the "Air Buddies" series. Directed by Robert Vince; written by Robert Vince & Anna McRoberts.(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Chihuahua 3: Viva La Fiesta!
programme.desc: Ay Chihuahua! Papi, Chloe and their pups are back in this third go-round that finds them wagging their way to a new life in a big hotel and planning the ultimate Quinceanera. Featuring the voices of George Lopez and Odette Annable; and starring Marcus Coloma and Erin Cahill. Directed by Lev L. Spiro; written by Dana Starfield, based on characters created by Jeff Bushell.(n)

programme.title: Akeelah and the Bee
programme.desc: A bright, but unmotivated, 11-year-old girl from South Los Angeles is encouraged to compete in the National Spelling Bee competition, tutored by a stern English professor in this inspiring, feel-good story. Starring Laurence Fishburne, Angela Bassett, Keke Palmer, Curtis Armstrong. Written and directed by Doug Atchison.(n)

programme.title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part
programme.desc: Everything is not so awesome in Bricksburg in this hit sequel! When Lego Duplo invaders threaten the city, it's up to Emmet, Lucy, and their pals to save the daya feat that requires them to travel through time and space. Featuring the voices of Chris Pratt, Elizabeth Banks, Tiffany Haddish, Will Arnett, Stephanie Beatriz, Charlie Day, Alison Brie, Nick Offerman and Maya Rudolph. Directed by Mike Mitchell; written by Phil Lord & Christopher Miller, based on Lego Construction Toys.(n)

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: His incredible works of fantasy topped by the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy have made J.R.R. Tolkien one of the greatest authors of our time but it was the turbulence of his youth that would shape his work. Nicholas Hoult is "convincingly smart" (Hollywood Reporter) as the young Tolkien whose fellowship with a group of like-minded friends is shaken by the brutality of World War I. Lily Collins co-stars as the young woman who snares his heart. Colm Meaney and Derek Jacobi co-star. Directed by Dome Karukoski; written by David Gleeson and Stephen Beresford.(n)

A hilarious comedy with heart that features loads of cameos from former child stars, including Leif Garrett, Butch Patrick, Gary Coleman, Corey Haim and more. Directed by Sam Weisman; written by Fred Wolf & David Spade.(n)

Can he prove his worth to the farmer before he winds up on a dinner plate? Sure...with a little help from his barnyard buddies! James Cromwell and Magda Szubanski star, with the voices of Christine Cavanaugh, Miriam Margolyes, Danny Mann, Hugo Weaving, Miriam Flynn, Russie Taylor, Evelyn Krape and Roscoe Lee Browne. programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia

Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Robert Patrick and Zooey Deschanel star in this heartwarming family film about friendship and the power of imagination. Directed by Gabor Csupo; screenplay by Jeff Stockwell and David Paterson, based on the book by Katherine Paterson.(n)

programme.title: By the People: The Election of Barack Obama
programme.desc: Barack Obama made history when he was elected the 44th President of the United States. But his journey from the U.S. Senate to the White House began more than two years earlier, when whispers of his possible candidacy galvanized a small core of believers. This film reveals the exclusive inside story of the Obama campaign, focusing on the candidate, family members, staffers and voters who helped turn an unlikely American dream into a reality.(n)

programme.title: Mr. Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: A successful businessman gets a lesson in fatherhood from some rambunctious penguins in this "hilarious and heartwarming movie for everyone" (Boxoffice Magazine). Tom Popper (Jim Carrey) is a divorced, high-powered real estate developer who seemingly has it all. What he doesn't have is time for his family. But that all changes after he inherits six penguins from his explorer father. Soon, his posh Manhattan apartment is turned into an arctic playground, much to the delight of his two kids. Co-starring Carla Gugino, Angela Lansbury, Ophelia Lovibond, Madeline Carroll, Clark Gregg and Jeffrey Tambor. Directed by Mark Waters; written by Sean Anders, John Morris and Jared Stern, based on the book by Richard and Florence Atwater. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie
programme.desc: Can the Power Rangers save the world from certain doom? They'll have to defeat the evil space pirate Divatox to do it! It's a battle to end all battles in this fantastic adventure. Johnny Yong Bosch, Nakia Burrise, Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank, Austin St. John, Catherine Sutherland, Jason Narvy, Paul Schreir, Hilary Shepard Turner, Amy Jo Johnson and Blake Foster star. Directed by David Winning and Shuki Levy; written by Shuki Levy & Shell Danielson. (PG) (V).(n)

programme.title: Like Mike 2: Streetball
programme.desc: Magical basketball sneakers transform a wispy young hoops player into a slam-dunking superstar in this comedy. Jerome Jenkins Junior (Jascha Washington) becomes an instant legend on his local streetball and even gets a cool nickname--"Triple J"--but his arrogant new off-court attitude is nothing but an air ball to his family and friends. Co-starring Kel Mitchell, Michael Beach, Brett Kelly, Micah Williams, Blu Mankuma, Michael Adamthwaite and Moneca Delain. Directed by David Nelson; written by Keith Mitchell & Allie Dvorin, based upon characters created by Michael Elliot. (PG) ().(n)

programme.title: The Kid Who Would Be King
programme.desc: The legend of King Arthur gets a "modern, crowd-pleasing twist" (Common Sense Media) in this family-friendly adventure in which a young schoolboy comes across the mythical sword Excalibur. With help from his friends and the mischievous wizard Merlin, young Alex must undertake a dangerous quest to save humanity from a diabolical enchantress. Starring Louis Ashbourne Serkis, Tom Taylor, Rebecca Ferguson and Patrick Stewart. Written and directed by Joe Cornish.(n)

programme.title: The Pacifier
programme.desc: He's an ace Navy SEAL who has completed missions all over the world. But now, Shane Wolfe is faced with his toughest assignment: children! Vin Diesel stars in this action-comedy as the tough-as-nails Wolfe who finds himself in unfamiliar territorydealing with everything from troubled teens to dirty diaperswhile keeping the five Plummer kids safe from their late dad's enemies. Co-starring Lauren Graham, Faith Ford, Brittany Snow, Max Thieriot, Morgan York, Carol Kane and Brad Garrett. Directed by Adam Shankman; written by Thomas Lennon & Robert Ben Garant.(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Life is a dragliterally!for a divorced actor whose wife gets full custody of his adored kids. To be near them, Robin Williams dresses up as sweet Mrs. Doubtfire and gets hired as the family nanny! "Williams is a drag-out hit" (Hollywood Reporter) as the loving dad in this hit family comedy. Sally Field is his long-suffering wife, and Pierce Brosnan plays her new beau. With Harvey Fierstein and Robert Prosky. Directed by Chris Columbus; screenplay by Leslie Dixon and Randi Mayem Singer, based on the novel by Anne Fine.(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Life is a dragliterally!for a divorced actor whose wife gets full custody of his adored kids. To be near them, Robin Williams dresses up as sweet Mrs. Doubtfire and gets hired as the family nanny! "Williams is a drag-out hit" (Hollywood Reporter) as the loving dad in this hit family comedy. Sally Field is his long-suffering wife, and Pierce Brosnan plays her new beau. With Harvey Fierstein and Robert Prosky. Directed by Chris Columbus; screenplay by Leslie Dixon and Randi Mayem Singer, based on the novel by Anne Fine.(n)

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: Life on the farm proves to be challenging for a plucky pig in this endearing family comedy. Not only is good-natured Babe unaware of his lowly position on the food chain, but he's also got it in his head to become the farm's resident shepherd! Can he prove his worth to the farmer before he winds up on a dinner plate? Sure...with a little help from his barnyard buddies! James Cromwell and Magda Szubanski star, with the voices of Christine Cavanaugh, Miriam Margolyes, Danny Mann, Hugo Weaving, Miriam Flynn, Russie Taylor, Evelyn Krape and Roscoe Lee Browne. Directed by Chris Noonan; written by George Miller and Chris Noonan. (G) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Toys
programme.desc: If this whimsical comic fantasy directed by Barry Levinsondoesn't bring out the kid in you, nothing will! When dying toymaker Donald O'Connor wills his factory to his army officer brother, he doesn't know the trouble he's going to cause. The militaristic madman wants to make nothing but war toys that will train kids to use real weapons. Now it's up to the rightful heirs, Robin Williams and Joan Cusack, to set things right! With Michael Gambon, Robin Wright and L.L. Cool J. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Toys
programme.desc: If this whimsical comic fantasy directed by Barry Levinsondoesn't bring out the kid in you, nothing will! When dying toymaker Donald O'Connor wills his factory to his army officer brother, he doesn't know the trouble he's going to cause. The militaristic madman wants to make nothing but war toys that will train kids to use real weapons. Now it's up to the rightful heirs, Robin Williams and Joan Cusack, to set things right! With Michael Gambon, Robin Wright and L.L. Cool J. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Teen Witch
programme.desc: A class frump uses her newfound magical powers to cast a spell over her entire school in this bewitching teen comedy. A week before her Sweet Sixteen, Louise goes to a fortune-teller and discovers she's descended from the Salem witches. Soon she's conjuring up all sorts of real-life fantasies...including a romance with the school hunk! Starring Robyn Lively, Zelda Rubinstein, Dan Gauthier, Joshua Miller and Dick Sargent. Directed by Dorian Walker; written by Robin Menken & Vernon Zimmerman.(n)

programme.title: Teen Witch
programme.desc: A class frump uses her newfound magical powers to cast a spell over her entire school in this bewitching teen comedy. A week before her Sweet Sixteen, Louise goes to a fortune-teller and discovers she's descended from the Salem witches. Soon she's conjuring up all sorts of real-life fantasies...including a romance with the school hunk! Starring Robyn Lively, Zelda Rubinstein, Dan Gauthier, Joshua Miller and Dick Sargent. Directed by Dorian Walker; written by Robin Menken & Vernon Zimmerman.(n)

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton!
programme.desc: A wholesome rural grocery clerk enters a contest for a once-in-a-lifetime dream date with a handsome movie star and wins his heart--to her lovelorn friend's chagrin--in this romantic comedy. Tad Hamilton is a celebrity in need of some desperate publicity to erase the streak of bad press he's received about his wild ways. A contest is devised to offer one lucky lady the chance to win a date with the Tinseltown troublemaker. Across the country in West Virginia, good-girl grocery clerk Rosalee Futch (Kate Bosworth) openly pines for the poster-boy...to the dismay of her lifelong friend Pete who harbors a secret crush on Rosalee. But when Rosalee wins the dream date and goes to Hollywood, the last thing Pete expects is for Tad to fall head over heels for the girl he loves! Starring Topher Grace, Josh Duhamel, with Sean Hayes and Nathan Lane. Directed by Robert Luketic, written by Victor Levin. (PG13) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Win a Date With Tad Hamilton!
programme.desc: A wholesome rural grocery clerk enters a contest for a once-in-a-lifetime dream date with a handsome movie star and wins his heart--to her lovelorn friend's chagrin--in this romantic comedy. Tad Hamilton is a celebrity in need of some desperate publicity to erase the streak of bad press he's received about his wild ways. Starring Topher Grace, Josh Duhamel, with Sean Hayes and Nathan Lane. Directed by Robert Luketic, written by Victor Levin. (PG13) (AC,AL).(n)

Johnny Yong Bosch, Nakia Burrise, Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank, Austin St. John, Catherine Sutherland, Jason Narvy, Paul Schreir, Hilary Shepard Turner, Amy Jo Johnson and Blake Foster star. Directed by David Winning and Shuki Levy; written by Shuki Levy & Shell Danielson. (PG) (V).(n)

programme.title: Battle for Terra
programme.desc: When the inhabitants of a peaceful planet come under attack by the last surviving remnants of humanity, a rebellious young alien girl forms an unlikely alliance with a human pilot to battle the hostile invaders. The stellar voice cast of this "thrilling" (San Francisco Chronicle) animated sci-fi tale includes Evan Rachel Wood, Brian Cox, James Garner, Danny Glover, Amanda Peet, David Cross, Justin Long with Dennis Quaid and Luke Wilson. Directed by Aristomenis Tsirbas; screenplay by Evan Spiliotopoulos, story by Aristomenis Tsirbas. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Air Buddies
programme.desc: When dog-nappers snatch their canine parents, it's up to five feisty puppies to save the day in this sixth riotous adventure in the "Air Bud" series. Featuring the voices of Slade Pearce, Trevor Wright, Christian Pikes, Paul Rae, Abigail Breslin, Michael Clarke Duncan, Don Knotts and Patrick Cranshaw. Directed by Robert Vince; written by Anna McRoberts, Robert Vince and Phil Hanley, based on characters by Paul Tamasy, Aaron Mendelsohn and Kevin DiCicco.(n)

programme.title: Home Alone 4
programme.desc: Ingenious kid Kevin McCallister proves once again he is the master of the booby trap as he schemes to foil the ransom plans of an old nemesis and his cronies in this riotous fourth film in the "Home Alone" series. French Stewart, Mike Weinberg, Missi Pyle, Jason Beghe, Erick Avari, Barbara Babcock, Joanna Going and Clare Carey star. Directed by Rod Daniel; written by Debra Frank & Steve L. Hayes.(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Stubby: An American Hero
programme.desc: A stray dog joins his master on the battlefields of World War I in this fact-based animated story. Featuring the voices of Logan Lerman, Helena Bonham Carter and Gerard Depardieu. Directed by Richard Lanni; written by Richard Lanni and Mike Stokey.(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked
programme.desc: Mischievous musical chipmunks Alvin, Simon and Theodore kick it into survivor mode when they wind up stranded on a deserted island in this third riotous part in the series. Thanks (as usual) to the ever-troublesome Alvin, an innocent kite ride during a cruise ship voyage lands the Chipmunks in the remote paradise with their hapless buddy Dave (Jason Lee), their female-singing pals the Chipettes, and the nefarious Ian (David Cross). "It's good, clean, old-fashioned family fun" (Birmingham Mail). Co-starring Jenny Slate and Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler, Jesse McCartney, Amy Poehler, Anna Faris, Christina Applegate. Directed by Mike Mitchell; written by Jonathan Aibel Glenn Berger, based on characters created by Ross Bagdasarian and Janice Karman. (G) ().(n)

programme.title: Like Mike
programme.desc: Lil' Bow Wow stars as a young orphan who becomes an NBA superstar when he acquires a pair of sneakers once owned by a basketball legend. The shoes are electrocuted as young Calvin makes a wish to be like his idol and soon he's dribbling circles around the best ball players in the NBA. As Calvin tries to conceal his secret shoes from the media, he leads the L.A. Knights to the playoffs...and continues his search for an adoptive family. Morris Chestnut, Jonathan Lipnicki, Robert Forster, Crispin Glover and Eugene Levy co-star in this hilarious, heartwarming film. (PG) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days
programme.desc: Summer break turns into a series of adventures--and misadventures--for 'wimpy' eighth-grader Greg Heffley in this third film in the family series. His dad wants him to be productive with his time off, but Greg has other plans, such as pretending to work at a country club where a pretty schoolmate goes. Throw in love-struck brother Rodrick and a disastrous family trip with best friend Rowley and you've got the recipe for one unforgettable summer! Starring Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron, Devon Bostick, Rachael Harris and Steve Zahn. Directed by David Bowers; screenplay by Maya Forbes & Wallace Wolodarsky, based upon the book by Jeff Kinney. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Journey 2: The Mysterious Island
programme.desc: A coded distress message leads 17-year-old Josh on an adventure to Jules Verne's legendary 'Mysterious Island' in this thrilling sequel to 'Journey to the Center of the Earth.' Dwayne Johnson stars as Josh's step-dad whose attempt at father-son bonding sparks their journey to an island filled with incredible wonders...and unimaginable dangers. With only days to spare before the entire island is under water, the group must navigate giant lizards, bugs, birds, and even electric eels if they want to live to tell their amazing tale. Michael Caine, Josh Hutcherson, Vanessa Hudgens, Luis Guzman and Kristin Davis co-star. Directed by Brad Peyton; screenplay by Brian Gunn & Mark Gunn, story by Richard Outten and Brian Gunn & Mark Gunn. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Herbie: Fully Loaded
programme.desc: The Love Bug is back! Herbie, the 1963 Volkswagen Beetle with a mind of his own, roars to life with spirited Lindsay Lohan behind the wheel and steering him into immortality on the NASCAR circuit. Justin Long, Breckin Meyer, Matt Dillon and Michael Keaton round out a stellar supporting cast in this speedy-fun family comedy that is sure to leave kids in stitches (the laughing kind!). Directed by Angela Robinson; screenplay by Thomas Lennon & Robert Ben Garant and Alfred Gough & Miles Millar, story by Thomas Lennon & Robert Ben Garant and Mark Perez, based on characters created by Gordon Buford. (G) (NA).(n)

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted
programme.desc: "A sequel outdoes its original" (Denver Post) in this riotous third "Madagascar" adventure that finds the animal quartet--Alex the lion, Marty the zebra, Melman the giraffe, and Gloria the hippo--on the run from a determined animal-control officer throughout Europe. It's a veritable circus of laughs as the quartet hide out in a traveling circus where they make a few furry new friends. "Amazing animation...hilarious" (Washington Post). With the voices of: Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer, Jada Pinkett Smith, Sacha Baron Cohen, Cedric the Entertainer, Andy Richter, Tom McGrath, Frances McDormand, Jessica Chastain, Bryan Cranston and Martin Short. Directed by Eric Darnell, Conrad Vernon, Tom McGrath; screenplay by Eric Darnell and Noah Baumbach. Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (TM) 2012 DreamWorks Animation LLC. All Rights Reserved. (PG) ().(n)

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: An all-star cast and state-of-the-art CGI effects bring to life Andrew Lloyd Webber's beloved smash musical based on the poems of T.S. Eliot. Starring James Corden, Judi Dench, Jason Derulo, Idris Elba, Jennifer Hudson, Ian McKellen, Taylor Swift, Rebel Wilson, Francesca Hayward. Directed by Tom Hooper; screenplay by Lee Hall & Tom Hooper.(n)

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: An all-star cast and state-of-the-art CGI effects bring to life Andrew Lloyd Webber's beloved smash musical based on the poems of T.S. Eliot. Starring James Corden, Judi Dench, Jason Derulo, Idris Elba, Jennifer Hudson, Ian McKellen, Taylor Swift, Rebel Wilson, Francesca Hayward. Directed by Tom Hooper; screenplay by Lee Hall & Tom Hooper.(n)

programme.title: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie

Directed by David Winning and Shuki Levy; written by Shuki Levy & Shell Danielson. (PG) (V).(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Following the global success of ''Godzilla'' and ''Kong: Skull Island'' comes the next chapter in the cinematic Monsterverse. This action adventure pits Godzilla against some of the most popular monsters in pop culture historyRodan, Mothra and the three-headed King Ghidorah. It's an epic monster mash as the clashing kaiju destroy cities in their wake while duking it out for supremacy. Starring Kyle Chandler, Vera Farmiga, Millie Bobby Brown, Bradley Whitford, Sally Hawkins, Charles Dance, Thomas Middleditch, Aisha Hinds, O'Shea Jackson Jr., David Strathairn with Ken Watanabe and Ziyi Zhang. Directed by Michael Dougherty; screenplay by Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, story by Max Borenstein and Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, based on the characters ''Godzilla,'' ''King Ghidorah,'' ''Mothra,'' and ''Rodan'' owned and created by Toho Co., LTD.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Following the global success of ''Godzilla'' and ''Kong: Skull Island'' comes the next chapter in the cinematic Monsterverse. This action adventure pits Godzilla against some of the most popular monsters in pop culture historyRodan, Mothra and the three-headed King Ghidorah. It's an epic monster mash as the clashing kaiju destroy cities in their wake while duking it out for supremacy. Starring Kyle Chandler, Vera Farmiga, Millie Bobby Brown, Bradley Whitford, Sally Hawkins, Charles Dance, Thomas Middleditch, Aisha Hinds, O'Shea Jackson Jr., David Strathairn with Ken Watanabe and Ziyi Zhang. Directed by Michael Dougherty; screenplay by Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, story by Max Borenstein and Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, based on the characters ''Godzilla,'' ''King Ghidorah,'' ''Mothra,'' and ''Rodan'' owned and created by Toho Co., LTD.(n)

programme.title: Girl in Progress
programme.desc: A feisty teen who wants to grow up fast rebels against her single, often absent mom, who doesn't want to grow up at all, in this smart coming-of-age tale. Starring Eva Mendes, Matthew Modine, Cierra Ramirez, Patricia Arquette, Eugenio Derbez. Directed by Patricia Riggen; screenplay by Hiram Martinez.(n)

programme.title: Girl in Progress
programme.desc: A feisty teen who wants to grow up fast rebels against her single, often absent mom, who doesn't want to grow up at all, in this smart coming-of-age tale. Starring Eva Mendes, Matthew Modine, Cierra Ramirez, Patricia Arquette, Eugenio Derbez. Directed by Patricia Riggen; screenplay by Hiram Martinez.(n)

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: Adam Sandler goes back to primary school as a lazy 27-year-old who has six months to graduate or risk losing the family business in this comedy. Billy Madison is the heir to the Madison Hotel chain fortune...if he can get his act together. His father is approaching retirement and plans to hand the company to his childish son on one condition--if Billy returns to school and passes 12 grades in 24 weeks. But if Billy can't complete his education, the company may fall into nefarious hands! With Darren McGavin, Bridgette Wilson, Bradley Whitford, Josh Mostel and Norm MacDonald. Written by Tim Herlihy and Adam Sandler. Directed by Tamra Davis. (PG13) (AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: Adam Sandler goes back to primary school as a lazy 27-year-old who has six months to graduate or risk losing the family business in this comedy. Billy Madison is the heir to the Madison Hotel chain fortune...if he can get his act together. His father is approaching retirement and plans to hand the company to his childish son on one condition--if Billy returns to school and passes 12 grades in 24 weeks. But if Billy can't complete his education, the company may fall into nefarious hands! With Darren McGavin, Bridgette Wilson, Bradley Whitford, Josh Mostel and Norm MacDonald. Written by Tim Herlihy and Adam Sandler. Directed by Tamra Davis. (PG13) (AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: "James Bond" and "Indiana Jones" team up when aliens invade the Old West in this "cinematic summer picnic suitable for the whole family" (Boston Globe). Daniel Craig is a mysterious outlaw with amnesia who lands in the middle of a war involving the local sheriff and greedy cattle baron Harrison Ford. It's got all the earmarks of a classic western showdown...until a hostile host of extraterrestrials attack, forcing the warring townsfolk to put aside their grudges and unite against a common enemy. "Cowboys and aliens make beautiful, fun music together" (Hollywood Reporter). Olivia Wilde, Sam Rockwell, Adam Beach, Paul Dano and Noah Ringer co-star. Directed by Jon Favreau; screenplay by Roberto Orci & Alex Kurtzman & Damon Lindelof and Mark Fergus & Hawk Ostby, screen story by Mark Fergus & Hawk Ostby and Steve Oedekerk, based on Platinum Studios' Cowboys and Aliens by Scott Mitchell Rosenberg. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: It's prehistoric mayhem for the Flintstones and their friends in this live-action family film based on the popular cartoon series. Stone Age spouse Fred Flintstone (John Goodman) is under pressure from wife Wilma and his mother-in-law when he nabs a remarkable raise at work. But the contemporary caveman doesn't realize the role his best bud Barney Rubble had in Fred's fortune. Can the rock-solid friends stay pals in the wake of Fred's promotion? With Rick Moranis, Elizabeth Perkins, Rosie O'Donnell, Kyle MacLachlan, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor. Directed by Brian Levant; written by Tom S. Parker, Jim Jennewein and Steven E. de Souza, based on the animated series by Hanna-Barbera. (PG) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: A Little Princess
programme.desc: In this "delicate, imaginative, beautifully mounted" (New York Daily News) family movie, based on the timeless children's classic, a resourceful young girl goes from riches to rags after her father is reported killed in WWI. But her vivid imagination, storytelling talent and supportive friends sustain her faith and hope through all her troubles. "An unself-conscious delight" (The New York Times). Starring Eleanor Bron, Liam Cunningham and introducing Liesel Matthews. Directed by Alfonso Cuaron; screenplay by Richard La Gravenese and Elizabeth Chandler, based on the novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett. (G) ().(n)

programme.title: Jetsons The Movie
programme.desc: George Jetson and his futuristic family--wife Jane, daughter Judy, son Elroy--are back with everyone's favorite space mutt Astro. In this feature-length animated adventure, George uses diplomacy in his effort to solve an interplanetary crisis involving teddy-bear-like alien saboteurs and his hot-headed boss, Mr. Spacely. Featuring the voices of George O'Hanlon, Mel Blanc, Tiffany, Patrick Zimmerman, Penny Singleton and Don Messick. Produced and directed by William Hanna & Joseph Barbera; screenplay by Dennis Marks. (G) ().(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: In this "marvelously designed piece of cartoon kinetics" (Entertainment Weekly) based on the classic Japanese TV show, a scientist creates a robot boy with super powers, x-ray vision and the ability to fly. The stellar voice cast includes Freddie Highmore, Kristen Bell, Nathan Lane, Eugene Levy, Matt Lucas, Bill Nighy, Donald Sutherland, Charlize Theron and Nicolas Cage. Directed by David Bowers; written by Timothy Hyde Harris and David Bowers, story by David Bowers. (PG) (AC,MV).(n)

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: From the creators of 'Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit' comes this hilarious animated adventure set in the sewers of London. Flushed down the toilet by a nasty sewer rat, pampered pet mouse Roddy St. James lands in the squalor of the city's smelly underworld. But getting back to his high-society digs proves much tougher than anticipated thanks to a villainous amphibian named Toad who has it out for young Roddy and pretty rat Rita, who is helping him escape. Featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Ian McKellen, Jean Reno, Bill Nighy, Andy Serkis and Shane Richie. Directed by David Bowers, Sam Fell; story by Sam Fell and Peter Lord and Dick Clement & Ian La Frenais; screenplay by Dick Clement & Ian La Frenais and Chris Lloyd & Joe Keenan and Will Davies. (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Walking With Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Prepare to enter the incredible prehistoric world of the dinosaurs in this epic adventure! With a herd of mighty pachyrhinosaurus' on the move and facing a variety of threats--including the terrifying T-Rex--it's up to one unlikely member of the group named Patchi to overcome his devious brother and lead them to safety. John Leguizamo, Justin Long and Karl Urban star in this gorgeous visual feast (Canada.com). Directed by Barry Cook, Neil Nightingale; screenplay by John Collee. (PG) ().(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: After Scrat's acorn antics cause a cataclysmic crack-up, Manny the Mammoth and his pals have to go on a high-seas quest aboard a floating iceberg--and clash with a band of misfit pirates--in this fourth entry in the hit animated series. Ray Romano, John Leguizamo and Denis Leary head up the all-star voice cast in this hilarious sequel. Also featuring the voices of Jennifer Lopez and Queen Latifah. Directed by Steve Martino, Michael Thurmeier; story by Michael Berg and Lori Forte; screenplay by Michael Berg and Jason Fuchs (PG) (MV).(n)

programme.title: Snow Buddies
programme.desc: The adventurous puppies journey to the Arctic for a thrilling dogsled race in this second installment in the "Air Buddies" franchise. Starring Jimmy Bennett, Mike Dopud, John Kapelos, Whoopi Goldberg, Jim Belushi and Kris Kristofferson. Directed by Robert Vince; written by Robert Vince and Anna McRoberts.(n)

programme.title: Everyone's Hero
programme.desc: A fired Yankee Stadium worker's son goes in search of Babe Ruth's stolen bat in this Depression-era animated tale. Yankee Irving can't hit a ball to save his life, but his luck only gets worse when his pop gets canned after sneaking the boy into the Stadium for a look at the Babe's lucky lumber. Can young Yankee find the stolen bat and save his dad's livelihood and reputation? William H. Macy, Rob Reiner, Brian Dennehy, Raven-Symoné, Robert Wagner, Richard Kind, Dana Reeve, Jake T. Austin, Joe Torre, Mandy Patinkin, Forest Whitaker and Whoopi Goldberg head up the voice cast. Major League Baseball trademarks and copyrights are used with permission of Major League Baseball Properties, Inc. (G) ().(n)

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: "James Bond" and "Indiana Jones" team up when aliens invade the Old West in this "cinematic summer picnic suitable for the whole family" (Boston Globe). Daniel Craig is a mysterious outlaw with amnesia who lands in the middle of a war involving the local sheriff and greedy cattle baron Harrison Ford. It's got all the earmarks of a classic western showdown...until a hostile host of extraterrestrials attack, forcing the warring townsfolk to put aside their grudges and unite against a common enemy. "Cowboys and aliens make beautiful, fun music together" (Hollywood Reporter). Olivia Wilde, Sam Rockwell, Adam Beach, Paul Dano and Noah Ringer co-star. Directed by Jon Favreau; screenplay by Roberto Orci & Alex Kurtzman & Damon Lindelof and Mark Fergus & Hawk Ostby, screen story by Mark Fergus & Hawk Ostby and Steve Oedekerk, based on Platinum Studios' Cowboys and Aliens by Scott Mitchell Rosenberg. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: It's happened again. For Phil, Stu and Alan, enduring a bachelor party as insane as the first one would be unimaginable...until now! In Thailand for Stu's wedding, a single beer on the beach turns into an epic night in Bangkok that none of them would ever forget--if they could remember it in the first place. With the wedding just hours away, the trio must piece together the raunchy events of the evening in an effort to find Stu's missing future brother in law. Starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Ken Jeong, Jeffrey Tambor with Justin Bartha and Paul Giamatti. Directed by Todd Phillips; written by Craig Mazin & Scot Armstrong & Todd Phillips. (R) (AC,AL,MV,N).(n)

programme.title: Clerks
programme.desc: In this comic highlight of the 1994 Sundance Film Festivalmade by first-time director Kevin Smith for only $27,000two New Jersey store clerks make it through their day...barely. Dante works in a convenience store, while his friend mans a video store. Both of them would rather be doing somethinganythingelse, and let their customers know it. "Buoyant, bleakly funny" (New York Times). With Brian O'Halloran, Jeff Anderson, Marilyn Ghigliotti, Lisa Spoonauer, Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith (as "Silent Bob"). Directed by Kevin Smith; written by Kevin Smith.(n)

programme.title: Little
programme.desc: When a high-powered boss-from-hell wakes up one morning back in her 13-year-old body, she learns some valuable life lessons as she's forced to relive the painful moments of her adolescence that turned her into a bullying adult. Regina Hall, Issa Rae (HBO's "Insecure") and Marsai Martin star in this clever comic fantasy. Directed by Tina Gordon; screenplay by Tracy Oliver and Tina Gordon, story by Tracy Oliver.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Nia Vardalos stars as a single girl who creates a major stir within her traditional Greek family by falling for a guy who has one fatal flaw--he's not Greek! John Corbett co-stars as the handsome gentleman who gets swept up in a big Greek love story in this riotous 2002 Best Original Screenplay Oscar(R) nominee that has become one of the most successful independent films ever made. The supporting cast includes Lainie Kazan, Michael Constantine, Gia Carides, Louis Mandylor with Andrea Martin. Written by Nia Vardalos, directed by Joel Zwick. (PG) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Fathers' Day
programme.desc: Which dad is the real dad? The hilarity begins when a beautiful woman tells two long-ago ex-lovers that each is the father of her runaway son. Inspired by unexpected fatherhood, neurotic bohemian Robin Williams and sly lawyer Billy Crystal are off and running, each determined to find "his" 16-year-old son. When they bump into each other and decide to work together, it's laughter all the way! Watch for Mel Gibson in a hilarious cameo. "High-powered teamwork!" (N.Y. Times). With Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Nastassja Kinski. Directed by Ivan Reitman; screenplay by Lowell Ganz & Babaloo Mandel, based on the film entitled "Los Comperes" by Francis Veber. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Adventures in Babysitting
programme.desc: A routine babysitting job turns into a wild night on the town for a Chicago teen in this lighthearted comedy. Elisabeth Shue stars as the high-school senior whose plans with her boyfriend fall through leading to a babysitting job that goes wildly awry. Keith Coogan, Anthony Rapp and Maia Brewton co-star. Directed by Chris Columbus; written by David Simkins.(n)

programme.title: Coupe de Ville
programme.desc: Three estranged brothers reunite for a cross-country road trip to bring their mother a surprise birthday Cadillac in this touching comedy. It's 1963 and years since the Libner brothers--Marvin, Buddy and Bobby--have faced each other. The mismatched trio battled in their youth and little has changed. But now it's their mother's 50th birthday and dad asks the boys to drive her present--a classic '50s Cadillac--from Michigan to their home in Florida. It's a long trip--can the brothers overcome their road rage and find harmony behind the wheel? Starring Daniel Stern, Patrick Dempsey, Arye Gross and Alan Arkin. Written by Mike Binder, directed by Joe Roth. (PG13) (AC,AL,SC,V).(n)

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: Widower Matt Damon comes up with a unique plan to lift his family out of their collective funk: by purchasing a ramshackle zoo. From director Cameron Crowe ('Almost Famous') comes this "enchanting" (New York magazine) tale that follows Benjamin Mee (Damon) and his two children--one a seven-year-old sweet pea, the other a brooding teen--as they try to start a new life in a place populated by wild animals and an equally quirky staff. Scarlett Johansson co-stars as the property's attractive zookeeper. Also with Thomas Haden Church, Patrick Fugit, Elle Fanning and John Michael Higgins. Directed by Cameron Crowe; screenplay by Aline Brosh McKenna and Cameron Crowe, based upon the book by Benjamin Mee. (PG) (AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: High Fidelity
programme.desc: Music-obsessed record-store manager John Cusack has a rankings list for everything in his life...including his Top 5 breakups. When his girlfriend leaves him for an arrogant New Age therapist, he tries to win her back--but first he must learn to show her the same passion he and his crazy co-workers have for vinyl. Jack Black, Lisa Bonet, Joelle Carter, Joan Cusack, Sara Gilbert, Iben Hjejle, Todd Louiso, Tim Robbins, Lili Taylor and Natasha Gregson Wagner co-star. Directed by Stephen Frears; screenplay by D.V. DeVincentis & Steve Pink & John Cusack and Scott Rosenberg, based upon the book by Nick Hornby. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: An adventure in babysitting leads college dropout Jonah Hill on a raunchy adventure through New York City with his three spirited charges in tow in this throwback comedy. Noah (Hill) is a likeable loser who doesn't know what he's in for when he agrees to watch a 9-year-old aspiring socialite, her mopey 13-year-old brother, and their explosives-obsessed foster brother. Described as a "wild and crazy romp" by Variety, the film follows the quartet on a hilarious and totally uncensored night of debauchery, drug dealers, "sharting," and more. Max Records, Ari Graynor, JB Smoove and Sam Rockwell star. Directed by David Gordon Green; written by Brian Gatewood & Alessandro Tanaka. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: For Bridget Jones, finding love was a lifelong quest. But now that she's found it, can she figure out a way to make it last? Renee Zellweger reprises her beloved screwball of a character in this sequel that finds her caught between her cad of a boss (Hugh Grant) and the upper-crust lawyer (Colin Firth) who won her heart in the first film. Directed by Beeban Kidron; screenplay by Andrew Davies and Helen Fielding and Richard Curtis and Adam Brooks, based on the novel by Helen Fielding. (R) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: The Banger Sisters
programme.desc: Two legendary former rock groupies reunite decades later in this free-spirited comedy-drama starring Goldie Hawn and Susan Sarandon. In their heyday, Vinnie and Suzette were inseparable pals sleeping their way through the rock-'n'-roll elite (and not so elite). More than twenty years later, Vinnie has hidden away her past and become a respectable member of society--while Suzette can still be found relating the story of Jim Morrison passing out on top of her. When Suzette loses her job, she picks up a squirrelly hitchhiker and heads for a reunion with her old pal...much to the consternation of the thoroughly uptight Vinnie. Geoffrey Rush, Erika Christensen and Robin Thomas co-star. Written and directed by Bob Dolman. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: 2 Minutes of Fame
programme.desc: After one of his videos goes viral, a comic (Jay Pharoah) goes to Los Angeles with dreams of stand-up stardom, but his girlfriend wants him to be a stand-up guy and help raise their young son. Co-starring Katt Williams, Keke Palmer, RonReaco Lee, Deon Cole, DC Young Fly and Jess Hilarious. Directed by Leslie Small; written by Devon Shepard and Yamara Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Descendants
programme.desc: "Alexander Payne has made his best film yet," says The Hollywood Reporter of this moving, funny tale from the director of "Sideways." George Clooney delivers an Oscar(R)-nominated performance as a Hawaiian real-estate lawyer and absentee-father of two girls who is thunderstruck when a horrific boating accident leaves his wife comatose. Suddenly, he finds himself forced to cope with the imminent loss of his partner, the bombshell discovery that she was cheating on him and the need by his daughters for him to be a real father--all while he tries to make a decision to sell or retain his family trust: 25,000 acres of undeveloped land on Kauai.An Oscar(R)-winner for Best Adapted Screenplay; nominated for four Oscars, including Best Picture. Shailene Woodley, Beau Bridges and Judy Greer co-star. Directed by Alexander Payne; screenplay by Alexander Payne and Nat Faxon Jim Rash, based upon the novel by Kaui Hart Hemmings. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: Working-class schlub Ben Stiller enlists the help of local street thug Eddie Murphy to help him and his co-workers steal back what's rightfully theirs in this "old-fashioned comedy caper" (Variety). Heading up the staff at a swank, ultra-secure high rise that caters to the wealthy, Josh Kovaks (Stiller) takes great pride in his work. But when the building's penthouse resident turns out to be a Bernie Madoff-styled con artist who has cleaned out the staff's retirement savings, it's up to Josh to lead a screwball break-in to the apartment to find the man's hidden millions. Casey Affleck, Alan Alda, Matthew Broderick, Tea Leoni, Michael Pena and Gabourey Sidibe co-star. Directed by Brett Ratner, screenplay by Ted Griffin and Jeff Nathanson, story by Adam Cooper & Bill Collage and Ted Griffin. (PG13) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy and Martin Lawrence are two 1930s New Yorkers sentenced to spend the rest of their days in a Mississippi jail--all because of a bootlegging trip gone wrong. Shortly after agreeing to leave the much more hospitable Harlem to get some liquor down South, the two kids find a good time--which unfortunately leads to them being framed for the death of a swindler. Decades later, prison doesn't look nearly so bad as one would expect for these "life"-long pals. Directed by Ted Demme; written by Robert Ramsey & Matthew Stone. (R) (AC,AL,V).(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: An adventure in babysitting leads college dropout Jonah Hill on a raunchy adventure through New York City with his three spirited charges in tow in this throwback comedy. Noah (Hill) is a likeable loser who doesn't know what he's in for when he agrees to watch a 9-year-old aspiring socialite, her mopey 13-year-old brother, and their explosives-obsessed foster brother. Described as a "wild and crazy romp" by Variety, the film follows the quartet on a hilarious and totally uncensored night of debauchery, drug dealers, "sharting," and more. Max Records, Ari Graynor, JB Smoove and Sam Rockwell star. Directed by David Gordon Green; written by Brian Gatewood & Alessandro Tanaka. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Boys and Girls
programme.desc: For polar opposites Ryan (Freddie Prinze Jr.) and Jennifer (Claire Forlani), a relationship that began with their meeting as 12-year-olds on an airplane has developed into an unexpected friendship. But could it blossom into something more? Perhaps...if their opposing views don't get in the way. Jason Biggs, Amanda Detmer and Heather Donahue co-star in this engaging romantic comedy. Directed by Robert Iscove; written by the Drews.(n)

programme.title: American Beauty
programme.desc: "I'll be dead in a year," says Lester Burnham (played by Kevin Spacey), a middle-aged man who is about to rebel against everything that holds him down in his life--his age, his wife (Annette Bening), his job, even his body. Inspired by his lust for his teenage daughter's sexy friend, Lester quits his job, starts working out, buys the car he's always wanted, puts his cheating wife in her place...and finally starts to live again. Thora Birch, Allison Janney, Peter Gallagher, Mena Suvari, Wes Bentley and Chris Cooper co-star. Winner of five 1999 Academy Awards(R) including Best Picture, Actor (Spacey), Director (Sam Mendes), Original Screenplay (Alan Ball) and Cinematography. "A flat-out masterpiece" (New York Post). Directed by Sam Mendes; screenplay by Alan Ball. (R) (AC,AL,N,V).(n)

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: Working-class schlub Ben Stiller enlists the help of local street thug Eddie Murphy to help him and his co-workers steal back what's rightfully theirs in this "old-fashioned comedy caper" (Variety). Heading up the staff at a swank, ultra-secure high rise that caters to the wealthy, Josh Kovaks (Stiller) takes great pride in his work. But when the building's penthouse resident turns out to be a Bernie Madoff-styled con artist who has cleaned out the staff's retirement savings, it's up to Josh to lead a screwball break-in to the apartment to find the man's hidden millions. Casey Affleck, Alan Alda, Matthew Broderick, Tea Leoni, Michael Pena and Gabourey Sidibe co-star. Directed by Brett Ratner, screenplay by Ted Griffin and Jeff Nathanson, story by Adam Cooper & Bill Collage and Ted Griffin. (PG13) (AC,AL).(n)

Shortly after agreeing to leave the much more hospitable Harlem to get some liquor down South, the two kids find a good time--which unfortunately leads to them being framed for the death of a swindler. Decades later, prison doesn't look nearly so bad as one would expect for these "life"-long pals. Directed by Ted Demme; written by Robert Ramsey & Matthew Stone. (R) (AC,AL,V).(n)

Described as a "wild and crazy romp" by Variety, the film follows the quartet on a hilarious and totally uncensored night of debauchery, drug dealers, "sharting," and more. Max Records, Ari Graynor, JB Smoove and Sam Rockwell star. Directed by David Gordon Green; written by Brian Gatewood & Alessandro Tanaka. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

But could it blossom into something more? Perhaps...if their opposing views don't get in the way. Jason Biggs, Amanda Detmer and Heather Donahue co-star in this engaging romantic comedy. Directed by Robert Iscove; written by the Drews.(n)
