programme.title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman stars as acclaimed photographer Diane Arbus in this artistic film exploring the inspiration that fueled her renowned work. A humble housewife and daughter to an affluent furrier, Diane Arbus led a mundane life as an assistant to her photographer husband in 1950s Manhattan. But living above her apartment, a peculiar cloaked man with a rare hair disorder piques Diane's curiosity and with his encouragement, her remarkable talent for capturing the extraordinary on film is revealed. Also with Robert Downey Jr., Ty Burrell, Harris Yulin and Jane Alexander. Directed by Steven Shainberg, inspired by the book Diane Arbus: A Biography by Patricia Bosworth, written by Erin Cressida Wilson. (R) (AC,AL,N).(n)

programme.title: A Prairie Home Companion
programme.desc: "Four stars...a lovely film" (Roger Ebert). Legendary director Robert Altman's final film before his death is a stirring recreation of Garrison Keillor's beloved radio show. Featuring an all-star cast along with Keillor and many of his amusing regulars, the film follows the events leading up to the final broadcast of the radio programwhich has been axed by its corporate owners. "Not since Woody Allen's Radio Days has anyone created such a cinematic Valentine to the wonderfully imaginative medium of radio" (Hollywood Reporter). Woody Harrelson, Tommy Lee Jones, Garrison Keillor, Kevin Kline, Lindsay Lohan, Virginia Madsen, John C. Reilly, Maya Rudolph, Meryl Streep, Lily Tomlin, Marylouise Burke, L.Q. Jones, Tim Russell and Sue Scott star. Directed by Robert Altman (Gosford Park); screenplay by Garrison Keillor; story by Garrison Keillor & Ken LaZebnik.(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth is ''brilliant'' (N.Y. Observer) in this chronicle of the complex relationship between famed literary editor Max Perkins, who discovered Ernest Hemingway and F. Scott Fitzgerald, and the eccentric novelist Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). Co-starring Nicole Kidman and Laura Linney, with Guy Pearce, Dominic West. Directed by Michael Grandage; screenplay by John Logan, based on the book by A. Scott Berg. (PG13) (AC,AL,BN).(n)

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: "Spectacular...serious-minded and well acted" (Seattle Times). Six months after the Japanese attack at Pearl Harbor, the United States Navy and a squad of intrepid fighter pilots take part in one of the most vital fights of World War II: the Battle of Midway. From the director of "Independence Day" comes this epic war picture that chronicles this ferocious battle that occurred from June 4-7, 1942. The stellar ensemble cast includes Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Luke Evans, Aaron Eckhart, Nick Jonas, Luke Kleintank, Darren Criss, Keean Johnson with Mandy Moore, Dennis Quaid and Woody Harrelson. Directed by Roland Emmerich; written by Wes Tooke.(n)

programme.title: Their Finest
programme.desc: As the Nazi Blitz rains down on Britain, a young woman plays an unlikely role in inspiring the nation when she takes a job as a scriptwriter on a major propaganda film. Gemma Arterton, Sam Claflin and a scene-stealing Bill Nighy head up the cast in this romantic comedy. "Four stars beautifully cast, intelligently written" (The Observer). Co-starring Jack Huston, Helen McCrory, Eddie Marsan, Jake Lacy, Rachael Stirling with Richard E. Grant. Directed by Lone Scherfig; screenplay by Gaby Chiappe, based on the novel "Their Finest Hour and a Half" by Lissa Evans.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
programme.desc: From producer James Wan (''Saw,'' ''The Conjuring'') comes this intense exercise in horror that centers on a woman who drowned her kids in a jealous rage in 17th-century Mexico and now haunts families in 1970s Los Angeles, searching for children to replace her own. Starring Linda Cardellini, Raymond Cruz, Patricia Velasquez, Marisol Ramirez, Sean Patrick Thomas, Jaynee-Lynne Kinchen, Roman Christou. Directed by Michael Chaves; written by Mikki Daughtry & Tobias Iaconis.(n)

programme.title: Just Mercy
programme.desc: Michael B. Jordan stars as Harvard-educated attorney Bryan Stevenson, who goes to Alabama in the 1980s to defend the poor, and fights to prove the innocence of a death row inmate (Jamie Foxx). Rob Morgan, Tim Blake Nelson, Rafe Spall and Brie Larson co-star in this inspirational true story. Directed by Destin Daniel Cretton; written by Destin Daniel Cretton & Andrew Lanham, based on the book by Bryan Stevenson.(n)

programme.title: His Dark Materials 12: Tower of the Angels
programme.desc: Will and Lyra make a plan, unaware of the dangers or the cost involved.(n)

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Denzel Washington delivers a searing performance as a desperate father who takes drastic measures when his son needs a heart transplant and health insurance won't cover the cost of the operation. Robert Duvall, James Woods, Anne Heche, Eddie Griffin, Shawn Hatosy, Kimberly Elise and Ray Liotta co-star. Directed by Nick Cassavetes; written by James Kearns.(n)

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Denzel Washington delivers a searing performance as a desperate father who takes drastic measures when his son needs a heart transplant and health insurance won't cover the cost of the operation. Robert Duvall, James Woods, Anne Heche, Eddie Griffin, Shawn Hatosy, Kimberly Elise and Ray Liotta co-star. Directed by Nick Cassavetes; written by James Kearns.(n)

programme.title: Alabama Snake
programme.desc: It's a chilling Southern Gothic tale of an attempted murder by rattlesnake. This documentary explores the mystifying events leading up to October 4, 1991, when an unusual violent crime was reported in Scottsboro, Alabama: Darlene Summerford accused her husband, Pentecostal preacher Glenn Summerford, of forcing her hand into a rattlesnake bed in an attempt to kill her. Employing dramatic re-creations and interviews with those who knew Summerford best, the documentary weaves between the past and present to unravel the details of the controversial investigation and trial that unfolded.(n)

programme.title: Alabama Snake
programme.desc: It's a chilling Southern Gothic tale of an attempted murder by rattlesnake. This documentary explores the mystifying events leading up to October 4, 1991, when an unusual violent crime was reported in Scottsboro, Alabama: Darlene Summerford accused her husband, Pentecostal preacher Glenn Summerford, of forcing her hand into a rattlesnake bed in an attempt to kill her. Employing dramatic re-creations and interviews with those who knew Summerford best, the documentary weaves between the past and present to unravel the details of the controversial investigation and trial that unfolded.(n)

programme.title: Industry 05: Learned Behaviour
programme.desc: As Pierpoint is shaken by a former employee's scathing expose, Eric goes offsite for the day, prompting an unauthorized Gus to cover trades from his desk, while Harper maneuvers her way into a meeting with one of Eric's coveted, disgruntled ex-clients. But when Gus and Harper both cross the line, they risk compromising their futures at the bank. Following Robert's successful first business trip, Clement treats him to a special outing, while Yasmin works her connections to land a major client meeting.(n)

programme.title: Industry 05: Learned Behaviour
programme.desc: As Pierpoint is shaken by a former employee's scathing expose, Eric goes offsite for the day, prompting an unauthorized Gus to cover trades from his desk, while Harper maneuvers her way into a meeting with one of Eric's coveted, disgruntled ex-clients. But when Gus and Harper both cross the line, they risk compromising their futures at the bank. Following Robert's successful first business trip, Clement treats him to a special outing, while Yasmin works her connections to land a major client meeting.(n)

programme.title: Euphoria: Trouble Don't Last Always
programme.desc: In the aftermath of being left by Jules at the train station and relapsing, Rue celebrates Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Euphoria: Trouble Don't Last Always
programme.desc: In the aftermath of being left by Jules at the train station and relapsing, Rue celebrates Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Baby God
programme.desc: Once hailed as a miracle worker, Dr. Quincy Fortier's secret is now out. Formerly a renowned Nevada fertility specialist, he has become best known for deceiving countless women struggling to conceive by using his own sperm--without their knowledge or consent--to impregnate them. Featuring intimate and revealing interviews with many of Fortier's children, the film takes a close, nuanced look at the lasting effects that Fortier's misdeeds have had--and will continue to have--on the women he victimized, as well as their children and generations to come. The result is a stunning expose of the egregious, once undetectable truths about Fortier's medical practice, as well as his alleged sexual abuse of family members.(n)

programme.title: Baby God
programme.desc: Once hailed as a miracle worker, Dr. Quincy Fortier's secret is now out. Formerly a renowned Nevada fertility specialist, he has become best known for deceiving countless women struggling to conceive by using his own sperm--without their knowledge or consent--to impregnate them. Featuring intimate and revealing interviews with many of Fortier's children, the film takes a close, nuanced look at the lasting effects that Fortier's misdeeds have had--and will continue to have--on the women he victimized, as well as their children and generations to come. The result is a stunning expose of the egregious, once undetectable truths about Fortier's medical practice, as well as his alleged sexual abuse of family members.(n)

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: An evil queen's quest to be the "fairest of them all" sets her on a course to vanquish the angelic Snow White in this thrilling fantasy/adventure that "reinvents the legendary story in a film of astonishing beauty and imagination" (Roger Ebert). Kristen Stewart plays the innocent beauty who heads to the forest to escape the sinister magic of Queen Ravenna (Charlize Theron) with help from the good-hearted huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) who was sent to kill her. Sam Claflin, Ian McShane, Bob Hoskins, Ray Winstone, Nick Frost and Toby Jones co-star. Directed by Rupert Sanders; screenplay by Evan Daugherty and John Lee Hancock and Hossein Amini, screen story by Evan Daugherty.(n)

programme.title: Stay
programme.desc: ''Stay' for a clever visual strategy' (Roger Ebert). A psychiatrist begins to experience strange alterations in reality when he takes on a suicidal patient in this mind-bending tale. Ewan McGregor stars as Dr. Sam Foster, a shrink whose new patient, an art student named Henry, reveals that he plans to kill himself in three days. What follows is a series of strange events and visions that leave Sam questioning reality--and his identity--in a scary surrealistic world. Naomi Watts co-stars as Sam's girlfriend Lila, whose past reveals some eerie similarities to Henry's life. Also with Ryan Gosling, Janeane Garofalo and Bob Hoskins. Directed by Marc Forster (Finding Neverland); written by David Benioff (Troy). (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: A Good Year
programme.desc: Max Skinner is a hard-charging bond trader preoccupied with money and power. But when he learns that his Uncle Henry died, Max has to leave his life in London behind and journey to Provence to dispose of his uncle's house and vineyards. The glorious setting proves more enticing than Max expected, and the local food and wine are almost as seductive as Fanny, the love-scarred local beauty. When a young American claiming to be Uncle Henry's daughter and Max's hilarious pal Charlie converge on the estate, things take an unexpected turn, and Max begins to remember the lessons his uncle taught him. With Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Marion Cotillard (La Vie en Rose), Abbie Cornish, Tom Hollander and Freddie Highmore (Charlie and the Chocolate Factory). Directed by Ridley Scott, based on the Book by Peter Mayle, screenplay by Marc Klein. (PG13) ().(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Nia Vardalos stars as a single girl who creates a major stir within her traditional Greek family by falling for a guy who has one fatal flaw--he's not Greek! John Corbett co-stars as the handsome gentleman who gets swept up in a big Greek love story in this riotous 2002 Best Original Screenplay Oscar(R) nominee that has become one of the most successful independent films ever made. The supporting cast includes Lainie Kazan, Michael Constantine, Gia Carides, Louis Mandylor with Andrea Martin. Written by Nia Vardalos, directed by Joel Zwick. (PG) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul
programme.desc: Judi Dench, who portrayed Queen Victoria in 1997's "Mrs. Brown," gives another superb performance as she returns to the role in this sumptuous production. The fact-based story blends humor and drama to chronicle the unlikely friendship that develops between the elderly queen and a young Indian clerk (Ali Fazal) who comes to England to participate in the Golden Jubilee centennial. Eddie Izzard, Adeel Akhtar and Michael Gambon co-star. Directed by Stephen Frears; screenplay by Lee Hall, based on the book by Shrabani Basu.(n)

programme.title: Cold Creek Manor
programme.desc: A New York City family's move to a large crumbling mansion in the country takes a harrowing turn with the return of the previous owner. Dennis Quaid and Sharon Stone head up the cast in this nail-biting thriller. Also with Stephen Dorff, Juliette Lewis, Kristen Stewart and Christopher Plummer. Directed by Mike Figgis; written by Richard Jefferies.(n)

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Daniel Day-Lewis "sews up another great performance" (NY Times) as a renowned perfectionist dressmaker in 1950s London whose cloistered world starts to unravel when a strong-willed waitress becomes his muse and lover. Lesley Manville and Vicky Krieps co-star in this "devilishly funny and luxuriantly sensuous" (Slate) tale from writer-director Paul Thomas Anderson ("Boogie Nights").(n)

programme.title: Somewhere
programme.desc: A burned-out Hollywood actor has his eyes opened during an unexpected trip with his 11-year-old daughter in this award-winning film written and directed by Sofia Coppola (Lost in Translation). Tired of playing "movie star" and merely going through the motions in everything from press junkets to sex, Johnny Marco (Stephen Dorff) has hit a serious rut. Though "father" is not a role he's used to playing, Johnny is forced to take his daughter Cleo (Elle Fanning) with him on a trip overseas--a journey that provides Johnny with a surprising chance to find redemption and hope. (R) (AC,AL,N).(n)

programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
programme.desc: Edward Norton stars in and directs this stylish neo-noir mystery about a private detective with Tourette syndrome who uncovers political corruption while trying to solve the murder of his mentor in 1950s New York. Co-starring Bruce Willis and Gugu Mbatha-Raw, with Alec Baldwin and Willem Dafoe. Directed by Edward Norton; screenplay by Edward Norton, based on the novel by Jonathan Lethem.(n)

programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
programme.desc: Edward Norton stars in and directs this stylish neo-noir mystery about a private detective with Tourette syndrome who uncovers political corruption while trying to solve the murder of his mentor in 1950s New York. Co-starring Bruce Willis and Gugu Mbatha-Raw, with Alec Baldwin and Willem Dafoe. Directed by Edward Norton; screenplay by Edward Norton, based on the novel by Jonathan Lethem.(n)

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: An evil queen's quest to be the "fairest of them all" sets her on a course to vanquish the angelic Snow White in this thrilling fantasy/adventure that "reinvents the legendary story in a film of astonishing beauty and imagination" (Roger Ebert). Kristen Stewart plays the innocent beauty who heads to the forest to escape the sinister magic of Queen Ravenna (Charlize Theron) with help from the good-hearted huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) who was sent to kill her. Sam Claflin, Ian McShane, Bob Hoskins, Ray Winstone, Nick Frost and Toby Jones co-star. Directed by Rupert Sanders; screenplay by Evan Daugherty and John Lee Hancock and Hossein Amini, screen story by Evan Daugherty.(n)

programme.title: Between The World And Me
programme.desc: Based on the 2018 adaptation and staging of Ta-Nehisi Coates' book at the Apollo Theater, this HBO Special features powerful readings from the book with documentary and archival footage, and animation. Focusing on the author's experiences growing up in inner-city Baltimore, the narrative explores Coates' bold notion that American society structurally supports white supremacy.(n)

programme.title: Axios 33
programme.desc: Guests: Alex Azar, United States Secretary of Health and Human Services; Christopher Krebs, Former CISA Director.(n)

programme.title: Axios 33
programme.desc: Guests: Alex Azar, United States Secretary of Health and Human Services; Christopher Krebs, Former CISA Director.(n)

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die
programme.desc: It's the living dead as only Jim Jarmusch could create. Here's all you need to know: the director of such indie favorites as "Broken Flowers" and "Stranger Than Paradise" takes a zombie invasion to a small town, whose sheriff happens to be Bill Murray. Big laughs and splatter ensue. The incredible supporting cast includes Adam Driver, Tilda Swinton, Chloe Sevigny, Steve Buscemi, Danny Glover, Caleb Landry Jones, Rosie Perez, Iggy Pop, Sara Driver, RZA, Selena Gomez, Carol Kane and Tom Waits. Written and directed by Jim Jarmusch.(n)

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die
programme.desc: It's the living dead as only Jim Jarmusch could create. Here's all you need to know: the director of such indie favorites as "Broken Flowers" and "Stranger Than Paradise" takes a zombie invasion to a small town, whose sheriff happens to be Bill Murray. Written and directed by Jim Jarmusch.(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: An adventure in babysitting leads college dropout Jonah Hill on a raunchy adventure through New York City with his three spirited charges in tow in this throwback comedy. Noah (Hill) is a likeable loser who doesn't know what he's in for when he agrees to watch a 9-year-old aspiring socialite, her mopey 13-year-old brother, and their explosives-obsessed foster brother. Described as a "wild and crazy romp" by Variety, the film follows the quartet on a hilarious and totally uncensored night of debauchery, drug dealers, "sharting," and more. Max Records, Ari Graynor, JB Smoove and Sam Rockwell star. Directed by David Gordon Green; written by Brian Gatewood & Alessandro Tanaka. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: An adventure in babysitting leads college dropout Jonah Hill on a raunchy adventure through New York City with his three spirited charges in tow in this throwback comedy. Noah (Hill) is a likeable loser who doesn't know what he's in for when he agrees to watch a 9-year-old aspiring socialite, her mopey 13-year-old brother, and their explosives-obsessed foster brother. Described as a "wild and crazy romp" by Variety, the film follows the quartet on a hilarious and totally uncensored night of debauchery, drug dealers, "sharting," and more. Max Records, Ari Graynor, JB Smoove and Sam Rockwell star. Directed by David Gordon Green; written by Brian Gatewood & Alessandro Tanaka. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: It's happened again. For Phil, Stu and Alan, enduring a bachelor party as insane as the first one would be unimaginable...until now! In Thailand for Stu's wedding, a single beer on the beach turns into an epic night in Bangkok that none of them would ever forget--if they could remember it in the first place. With the wedding just hours away, the trio must piece together the raunchy events of the evening in an effort to find Stu's missing future brother in law. Starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Ken Jeong, Jeffrey Tambor with Justin Bartha and Paul Giamatti. Directed by Todd Phillips; written by Craig Mazin & Scot Armstrong & Todd Phillips. (R) (AC,AL,MV,N).(n)

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: It's happened again. For Phil, Stu and Alan, enduring a bachelor party as insane as the first one would be unimaginable...until now! In Thailand for Stu's wedding, a single beer on the beach turns into an epic night in Bangkok that none of them would ever forget--if they could remember it in the first place. With the wedding just hours away, the trio must piece together the raunchy events of the evening in an effort to find Stu's missing future brother in law. Starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Ken Jeong, Jeffrey Tambor with Justin Bartha and Paul Giamatti. Directed by Todd Phillips; written by Craig Mazin & Scot Armstrong & Todd Phillips. (R) (AC,AL,MV,N).(n)

programme.title: Lowriders
programme.desc: A young street artist is forced to choose between the world of East L.A.'s Latino custom-car culture or following in the footsteps of his ex-con brother. Demian Bichir, Gabriel Chavarria, Theo Rossi, Melissa Benoist, Tony Revolori and Eva Longoria star in this powerful familial saga. Directed by Ricardo de Montreuil; written by Elgin James and Che Hodari Coker.(n)

programme.title: The Comebacks
programme.desc: A floundering football coach seeks a final shot at success in this comedy that spoofs classic sports films. Lambeau Fields has earned many losses in his coaching days, but when an opportunity to lead an inept Texas team surfaces, he's ready to tackle the W's into his column! Lampooning memorable sports movies such as Rudy, Rocky and Remember the Titans this comedy about a motley group of inadequate athletes keeps the laughs coming from the kickoff. Starring David Koechner, Carl Weathers and Melora Hardin. Directed by Tom Brady; screenplay by Ed Yeager, Joey Gutierrez; story by John Aboud, Michael Colton, Adam Jay Epstein and Andrew Jacobson. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: Putting "a fresh, invigorating spin on the superhero origin story," (Detroit News), this electrifying "found footage" thriller replays the video chronicle of three high-school teens who gain super-human powers after coming in contact with a mysterious rock. Awkward teen Andrew, his cousin Matt and campus superstar Steve become unlikely buddies as they record their incredible--and ever-developing--telekinetic powers. Soon they are moving objects at will and even flying, but with a price as Andrew becomes increasingly unhinged in the process. Dane Dehaan, Alex Russell, Michael B. Jordan, Michael Kelly and Ashley Hinshaw star. Directed by Josh Trank; screenplay by Max Landis, story by Max Landis & Josh Trank. (PG13) (AC,AL,V).(n)

programme.title: Tolkien: The Making Of
programme.desc: An in-depth preview of the film 'Tolkien.'.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Those about to rocksalute this film! Jack Black earned a Golden Globe(R) nomination for his hilarious and heartfelt performance in this "exuberant, raucous and thoroughly endearing comedy" (Washington Post). Tossed from his band, rock-and-roll-loving guitarist Dewey Finn (Black) lies his way into a substitute teaching job where he soon leads his musically talented young charges into a Battle of the Bands. Co-starring Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman. Directed by Richard Linklater; written by Mike White.(n)

programme.title: Zoetic
programme.desc: A coming of age story about a single, 60-year-old Chinese immigrant mother who, for the first time ever, is challenged to finally think of her own wants and needs. She reluctantly agrees to maneuver the world of online dating apps with the help of her daughter. Starring Dawn Ying Yuen, Julie Zhan, Julie's Grandpa, Julie's Grandpa, Zailee Madrigal, Phil Morris and Doug Burch. Directed by Wesley Chan and Julie Zhan; screenplay by Julie Zhan and Wesley Chan, story by Julie Zhan.(n)

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: Widower Matt Damon comes up with a unique plan to lift his family out of their collective funk: by purchasing a ramshackle zoo. From director Cameron Crowe ('Almost Famous') comes this "enchanting" (New York magazine) tale that follows Benjamin Mee (Damon) and his two children--one a seven-year-old sweet pea, the other a brooding teen--as they try to start a new life in a place populated by wild animals and an equally quirky staff. Scarlett Johansson co-stars as the property's attractive zookeeper. Also with Thomas Haden Church, Patrick Fugit, Elle Fanning and John Michael Higgins. Directed by Cameron Crowe; screenplay by Aline Brosh McKenna and Cameron Crowe, based upon the book by Benjamin Mee. (PG) (AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Between The World And Me
programme.desc: Based on the 2018 adaptation and staging of Ta-Nehisi Coates' book at the Apollo Theater, this HBO Special features powerful readings from the book with documentary and archival footage, and animation. Focusing on the author's experiences growing up in inner-city Baltimore, the narrative explores Coates' bold notion that American society structurally supports white supremacy.(n)

programme.title: Enemy of the State
programme.desc: Hotshot Washington, D.C. lawyer Robert Dean learns the hard way that it's not paranoia if they're really after you. When he is given a video tying a National Security Agency official to a murder, Dean goes on the run and meets up with a mysterious surveillance expert who helps him turn the tables on corrupt NSA agents who are waging a ruthless campaign to destroy Dean's life and retrieve the video. Will Smith and Gene Hackman star in this "dynamite thriller" (Rolling Stone). Co-starring Jon Voight, Regina King, Loren Dean, Jake Busey, Barry Pepper and Gabriel Byrne. Directed by Tony Scott; written by David Marconi. (R) (AC,AL,V).(n)

programme.title: His Dark Materials 09: The City of Magpies
programme.desc: Season Two Premiere. Lyra and Will explore a new world. The Magisterium take action on past events. Lee Scoresby embarks on a mission.(n)

programme.title: His Dark Materials 10: The Cave
programme.desc: Lyra and Will head to Oxford for answers. The Magisterium is faced with a choice.(n)

programme.title: His Dark Materials 11: Theft
programme.desc: Lyra ignores the alethiometer's advice leading to dangerous consequences.(n)

programme.title: Halwa
programme.desc: When Sujata gets an unexpected piece of news about her secret childhood sweetheart and best friend, Premila, she begins to rekindle the spark with the aid of a new Facebook account, but her abusive husband takes notice. Vee Kumari, Asit Vyas, Sanchita Malik, Aishveryaa Nidhi, Samiya Khan, Sonal Shah, Puja Gupta and Renu Razdan star. Directed by Gayatri Bajpai and Nirav Bhakta.(n)

programme.title: Harriet
programme.desc: The extraordinary true story of abolitionist Harriet Tubman is chronicled in this first-rate drama that details her life from her harrowing escape from slavery to her leading hundreds of slaves to freedom via the Underground Railroad. Cynthia Erivo (HBO's "The Outsider") earned Oscar(R) and Golden Globe(R) nominations for her moving performance as Harriet. Co-starring Leslie Odom Jr. and Janelle Monae. "A rousing and powerful drama" (The New York Times). Directed by Kasi Lemmons; screenplay by Gregory Allen Howard and Kasi Lemmons, story by Gregory Allen Howard.(n)

programme.title: Harriet

"A rousing and powerful drama" (The New York Times). Directed by Kasi Lemmons; screenplay by Gregory Allen Howard and Kasi Lemmons, story by Gregory Allen Howard.(n)

programme.title: Precious
programme.desc: An abused, illiterate, overweight and pregnant teen is offered a glimmer of hope to change her life by a teacher at an alternative school. Winner of two Oscars(R), this powerful drama stars Mo'Nique, Paula Patton, Mariah Carey, Sherri Shepherd, Lenny Kravitz and Gabourey Sidibe. Directed by Lee Daniels; screenplay by Geoffrey Fletcher, based on the novel "Push" by Sapphire.(n)

programme.title: Precious
programme.desc: An abused, illiterate, overweight and pregnant teen is offered a glimmer of hope to change her life by a teacher at an alternative school. Winner of two Oscars(R), this powerful drama stars Mo'Nique, Paula Patton, Mariah Carey, Sherri Shepherd, Lenny Kravitz and Gabourey Sidibe. Directed by Lee Daniels; screenplay by Geoffrey Fletcher, based on the novel "Push" by Sapphire.(n)

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: Natalie Portman stars as an astronaut whose transcendent experiences in space leave her unhappy with her dreary life on Earth as she starts to lose her grip on reality. Jon Hamm, Dan Stevens, Zazie Beetz, Pearl Amanda Dickson and Ellen Burstyn co-star in this drama inspired by real events. Directed by Noah Hawley; written by Brian C. Brown & Elliott DiGuiseppi and Noah Hawley.(n)

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Time is the ultimate currency in a dystopian future in which humans stop aging at 25--but die in a year unless they get more time. From out of this dark dynamic--where the rich can live forever while the working class dies--emerges hope in the person of Will Salas. Given more than a century by a rich man, Will sets out to destroy the system with help from a greedy tycoon's daughter, a quest that puts him in the crosshairs of a determined time cop. Amanda Seyfried and Justin Timberlake star in this dark tale. Cillian Murphy, Olivia Wilde and Alex Pettyfer co-star. Directed and written by Andrew Niccol. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Trust the Man
programme.desc: Billy Crudup, David Duchovny, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Julianne Moore pair off to star as two New York couples seeking solutions to their domestic problems in this romantic comedy. Rebecca and Tom are married with kids--she's a busy flourishing actress, he's a stay-at-home dad in sexual overdrive. Meanwhile, Rebecca's lazybones brother Tobey has a live-in girlfriend Elaine, a novice author who seeks a deeper commitment...and possibly children. With a marriage counselor, an ex-girlfriend and a pretty playgroup mom thrown in the mix, could their coupling troubles get any more complex? Also with Eva Mendes and James Le Gros. Written and directed by Bart Freundlich. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: The Beguiled (2017)
programme.desc: Sofia Coppola's "lurid, sweltering, and sensationally fun" (IndieWire) adaptation of this Southern Gothic tale of sexual rivalries, (previously filmed in 1971 with Clint Eastwood), stars Colin Farrell as a wounded Union soldier who triggers dangerous desires when he's taken in by the headmistress of an all-girls boarding school. Nicole Kidman, Kirsten Dunst and Elle Fanning co-star. Written for the screen and directed by Sofia Coppola, based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: From the makers of "Bridget Jones's Diary" and "Notting Hill" comes this "sexy love match" (US Weekly) about a rising American tennis star who falls for a British contender on the downside of his career, while competing in the prestigious Wimbledon tournament in London. Kirsten Dunst and Paul Bettany star in this charming romantic comedy. With Sam Neill and Jon Favreau. Directed by Richard Loncraine, written by Adam Brooks and Jennifer Flackett & Mark Levin. (PG13) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel 283
programme.desc: Segments: A surprising look at how psychedelic drugs can be used to treat depression, addiction and anxiety in athletes with head injuries; explorer Victor Vescovo has spent his fortune uncovering the deepest, most unknown parts of our planet; Meet some of sports' biggest super fans who are agonizing over being locked out of stadiums due to the pandemic.(n)

programme.title: Little
programme.desc: When a high-powered boss-from-hell wakes up one morning back in her 13-year-old body, she learns some valuable life lessons as she's forced to relive the painful moments of her adolescence that turned her into a bullying adult. Regina Hall, Issa Rae (HBO's "Insecure") and Marsai Martin star in this clever comic fantasy. Directed by Tina Gordon; screenplay by Tracy Oliver and Tina Gordon, story by Tracy Oliver.(n)

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Denzel Washington delivers a searing performance as a desperate father who takes drastic measures when his son needs a heart transplant and health insurance won't cover the cost of the operation. Robert Duvall, James Woods, Anne Heche, Eddie Griffin, Shawn Hatosy, Kimberly Elise and Ray Liotta co-star. Directed by Nick Cassavetes; written by James Kearns.(n)

programme.title: Underwater
programme.desc: Seven miles below the surface of the ocean something has awakened. Stranded on the ocean's floor after an earthquake, the crew of a drilling station attempt to escape only to encounter a monstrous presence with a bad attitude. Kristen Stewart, Vincent Cassel, Jessica Henwick, John Gallagher Jr., Mamoudou Athie and T.J. Miller star in this terrifying deep-sea monster movie. Directed by William Eubank; screenplay by Brian Duffield and Adam Cozad, story by Brian Duffield.(n)

programme.title: Alabama Snake
programme.desc: It's a chilling Southern Gothic tale of an attempted murder by rattlesnake. This documentary explores the mystifying events leading up to October 4, 1991, when an unusual violent crime was reported in Scottsboro, Alabama: Darlene Summerford accused her husband, Pentecostal preacher Glenn Summerford, of forcing her hand into a rattlesnake bed in an attempt to kill her. Employing dramatic re-creations and interviews with those who knew Summerford best, the documentary weaves between the past and present to unravel the details of the controversial investigation and trial that unfolded.(n)

programme.title: The Photograph
programme.desc: A picture from her late mother's past sends a renowned photographer on a search for answersand into an unexpected love affair with a handsome journalist. Issa Rae and LaKeith Stanfield star in this "rare treasure of a romantic drama" (Culture Mix). Co-starring Lil Rel Howery, Rob Morgan and Courtney B. Vance. Written and directed by Stella Meghie.(n)

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Time is the ultimate currency in a dystopian future in which humans stop aging at 25--but die in a year unless they get more time. From out of this dark dynamic--where the rich can live forever while the working class dies--emerges hope in the person of Will Salas. Given more than a century by a rich man, Will sets out to destroy the system with help from a greedy tycoon's daughter, a quest that puts him in the crosshairs of a determined time cop. Amanda Seyfried and Justin Timberlake star in this dark tale. Cillian Murphy, Olivia Wilde and Alex Pettyfer co-star. Directed and written by Andrew Niccol. (PG13) (AC,AL,MV).(n)

programme.title: Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel 283
programme.desc: Segments: A surprising look at how psychedelic drugs can be used to treat depression, addiction and anxiety in athletes with head injuries; explorer Victor Vescovo has spent his fortune uncovering the deepest, most unknown parts of our planet; Meet some of sports' biggest super fans who are agonizing over being locked out of stadiums due to the pandemic.(n)

programme.title: Between The World And Me
programme.desc: Based on the 2018 adaptation and staging of Ta-Nehisi Coates' book at the Apollo Theater, this HBO Special features powerful readings from the book with documentary and archival footage, and animation. Focusing on the author's experiences growing up in inner-city Baltimore, the narrative explores Coates' bold notion that American society structurally supports white supremacy.(n)

programme.title: Murder on Middle Beach 04: Reasonable Doubts
programme.desc: Finale. With the ten-year anniversary of his mother's death approaching, Madison leaves no stone unturned in his quest for the truth  despite concerns that his documentary may be doing more harm than good. As Madison presses on, there are surprising roadblocks to his investigation.(n)

programme.title: Axios 33
programme.desc: Guests: Alex Azar, United States Secretary of Health and Human Services; Christopher Krebs, Former CISA Director.(n)

programme.title: Industry 05: Learned Behaviour
programme.desc: As Pierpoint is shaken by a former employee's scathing expose, Eric goes offsite for the day, prompting an unauthorized Gus to cover trades from his desk, while Harper maneuvers her way into a meeting with one of Eric's coveted, disgruntled ex-clients. But when Gus and Harper both cross the line, they risk compromising their futures at the bank. Following Robert's successful first business trip, Clement treats him to a special outing, while Yasmin works her connections to land a major client meeting.(n)

programme.title: Transhood
programme.desc: Directed by Sharon Liese, this documentary is an inspiring chronicle of the lives of four young people  aged 4, 7, 12, and 15 at the start of filming  and their families as they navigate growing up transgender in America's heartland. Moving and thought-provoking, the film follows these courageous families from a politically and religiously conservative Kansas City community over the course of five years, exploring how they struggle and stumble through parenting, and how the kids are challenged and transformed as they experience the complexity of their identities and redefine "coming of age.".(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese's brutally majestic epic set in mid-19th century Lower Manhattan revolves around a young Irish immigrant (Leonardo DiCaprio) seeking revenge against the rival gang leader who killed his father. Co-starring Daniel Day-Lewis, Cameron Diaz, Jim Broadbent, John C. Reilly, Henry Thomas, Brendan Gleeson. Directed by Martin Scorsese; screenplay by Jay Cocks and Steve Zaillian and Kenneth Lonergen, story by Jay Cocks.(n)

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: Brad Pitt gives an Oscar(R)-nominated performance in this whimsical fantasy as a man who is born in his 80s and ages backward, experiencing adventures from the end of World War I though the 21st century. Cate Blanchett, Taraji P. Henson, Julia Ormond, Jason Flemyng, Elias Koteas and Tilda Swinton co-star. Directed by David Fincher; screenplay by Eric Roth, story by Eric Roth and Robin Swicord, based on a short story by F. Scott Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Zoetic
programme.desc: A coming of age story about a single, 60-year-old Chinese immigrant mother who, for the first time ever, is challenged to finally think of her own wants and needs. She reluctantly agrees to maneuver the world of online dating apps with the help of her daughter. Starring Dawn Ying Yuen, Julie Zhan, Julie's Grandpa, Julie's Grandpa, Zailee Madrigal, Phil Morris and Doug Burch. Directed by Wesley Chan and Julie Zhan; screenplay by Julie Zhan and Wesley Chan, story by Julie Zhan.(n)

programme.title: The Book of Henry
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old genius discovers that the girl next door has a terrible secret, he asks his single mom to help carry out an ingenious plan he has devised to save her. Naomi Watts, Jaeden Lieberher, Jacob Tremblay, Sarah Silverman, Lee Pace and Dean Norris star in this emotional drama. Directed by Colin Trevorrow; written by Gregg Hurwitz.(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: A Maine orphanage during World War II is the setting for this Oscar(R)-winning drama based on the acclaimed novel. Tobey Maguire stars as the home's oldest boy who, after years of helping the resident doctor, leaves to find his place in the world. Charlize Theron plays a young woman who falls into an affair with him after her boyfriend's plane is shot down in the war. Co-starring Delroy Lindo, Paul Rudd, Michael Caine, Jane Alexander, Kathy Baker, Kieran Culkin, Heavy D, Kate Nelligan and Erykah Badu. Winner of two Oscars, including Best Supporting Actor (Caine) and Best Adapted Screenplay. Directed by Lasse Hallstrom; written by John Irving based upon his novel. (PG13) (AC,AL,N,V).(n)

programme.title: Trust the Man
programme.desc: Billy Crudup, David Duchovny, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Julianne Moore pair off to star as two New York couples seeking solutions to their domestic problems in this romantic comedy. Rebecca and Tom are married with kids--she's a busy flourishing actress, he's a stay-at-home dad in sexual overdrive. Meanwhile, Rebecca's lazybones brother Tobey has a live-in girlfriend Elaine, a novice author who seeks a deeper commitment...and possibly children. With a marriage counselor, an ex-girlfriend and a pretty playgroup mom thrown in the mix, could their coupling troubles get any more complex? Also with Eva Mendes and James Le Gros. Written and directed by Bart Freundlich. (R) (AC,AL).(n)

programme.title: The Five-Year Engagement
programme.desc: From the duo behind "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" comes this "charming, funny" (New York magazine) romantic comedy that leaves the conventions of the genre behind. Jason Segel and Emily Blunt star as the smitten young couple whose journey down the aisle hits a series of speed bumps that threatens to tear them apart. Can they get past their respective differences and career aspirations to make it work? Rhys Ifans, Chris Pratt and Alison Brie co-star. Directed by Nicholas Stoller; written by Jason Segel & Nicholas Stoller.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Those about to rocksalute this film! Jack Black earned a Golden Globe(R) nomination for his hilarious and heartfelt performance in this "exuberant, raucous and thoroughly endearing comedy" (Washington Post). Tossed from his band, rock-and-roll-loving guitarist Dewey Finn (Black) lies his way into a substitute teaching job where he soon leads his musically talented young charges into a Battle of the Bands. Co-starring Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman. Directed by Richard Linklater; written by Mike White.(n)

programme.title: His Dark Materials 12: Tower of the Angels
programme.desc: Will and Lyra make a plan, unaware of the dangers or the cost involved.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Following the global success of ''Godzilla'' and ''Kong: Skull Island'' comes the next chapter in the cinematic Monsterverse. This action adventure pits Godzilla against some of the most popular monsters in pop culture historyRodan, Mothra and the three-headed King Ghidorah. It's an epic monster mash as the clashing kaiju destroy cities in their wake while duking it out for supremacy. Starring Kyle Chandler, Vera Farmiga, Millie Bobby Brown, Bradley Whitford, Sally Hawkins, Charles Dance, Thomas Middleditch, Aisha Hinds, O'Shea Jackson Jr., David Strathairn with Ken Watanabe and Ziyi Zhang. Directed by Michael Dougherty; screenplay by Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, story by Max Borenstein and Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, based on the characters ''Godzilla,'' ''King Ghidorah,'' ''Mothra,'' and ''Rodan'' owned and created by Toho Co., LTD.(n)

programme.title: Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel 283
programme.desc: Segments: A surprising look at how psychedelic drugs can be used to treat depression, addiction and anxiety in athletes with head injuries; explorer Victor Vescovo has spent his fortune uncovering the deepest, most unknown parts of our planet; Meet some of sports' biggest super fans who are agonizing over being locked out of stadiums due to the pandemic.(n)

programme.title: Axios 33
programme.desc: Guests: Alex Azar, United States Secretary of Health and Human Services; Christopher Krebs, Former CISA Director.(n)

programme.title: Murder on Middle Beach 04: Reasonable Doubts
programme.desc: Finale. With the ten-year anniversary of his mother's death approaching, Madison leaves no stone unturned in his quest for the truth  despite concerns that his documentary may be doing more harm than good. As Madison presses on, there are surprising roadblocks to his investigation.(n)

programme.title: 40 Years a Prisoner
programme.desc: In 1978, the escalating conflict between Philadelphia leadership and the Black liberation group MOVE led to one of the most controversial police shootouts in American historyand a son's four-decade-long fight to free his parents. The 1978 confrontation, which claimed the life of Officer James Ramp and saw unarmed MOVE member Delbert Africa nearly beaten to death, made headlines and culminated in murder charges and prison sentences of 30 to 100 years for nine MOVE members. This timely documentary chronicles the tireless fight by Mike Africa Jr., despite countless setbacks, to ensure the release of his parents and other MOVE members while illuminating the injustice under Police Commissioner-turned-Mayor Frank Rizzo and the media's role in exacerbating the conflict.(n)

programme.title: Munich
programme.desc: "Four stars" (Roger Ebert). Eleven Israeli athletes were murdered at the 1972 Olympics in Munich--this is the story of what happened next. From director Steven Spielberg comes this gripping thriller about the five men hired by the Israeli government for a top-secret mission to assassinate the 11 Palestinian terrorists responsible. Eric Bana, Daniel Craig, Ciaran Hinds, Mathieu Kassovitz, Hanns Zischler and Geoffrey Rush star in this "absorbing" (Roger Ebert) film about tragedy, revenge and the vicious cycle of violence in the Middle East. Directed by Steven Spielberg, based on the book Vengeance by George Jonas, screenplay by Tony Kushner and Eric Roth. Nominated for five 2005 Oscars(R) including Best Picture and Best Director (Spielberg). (R) (BN,GV).(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Following the global success of ''Godzilla'' and ''Kong: Skull Island'' comes the next chapter in the cinematic Monsterverse. This action adventure pits Godzilla against some of the most popular monsters in pop culture historyRodan, Mothra and the three-headed King Ghidorah. It's an epic monster mash as the clashing kaiju destroy cities in their wake while duking it out for supremacy. Starring Kyle Chandler, Vera Farmiga, Millie Bobby Brown, Bradley Whitford, Sally Hawkins, Charles Dance, Thomas Middleditch, Aisha Hinds, O'Shea Jackson Jr., David Strathairn with Ken Watanabe and Ziyi Zhang. Directed by Michael Dougherty; screenplay by Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, story by Max Borenstein and Michael Dougherty & Zach Shields, based on the characters ''Godzilla,'' ''King Ghidorah,'' ''Mothra,'' and ''Rodan'' owned and created by Toho Co., LTD.(n)

Eric Bana, Daniel Craig, Ciaran Hinds, Mathieu Kassovitz, Hanns Zischler and Geoffrey Rush star in this "absorbing" (Roger Ebert) film about tragedy, revenge and the vicious cycle of violence in the Middle East. Directed by Steven Spielberg, based on the book Vengeance by George Jonas, screenplay by Tony Kushner and Eric Roth. Nominated for five 2005 Oscars(R) including Best Picture and Best Director (Spielberg). (R) (BN,GV).(n)

programme.title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman stars as acclaimed photographer Diane Arbus in this artistic film exploring the inspiration that fueled her renowned work. A humble housewife and daughter to an affluent furrier, Diane Arbus led a mundane life as an assistant to her photographer husband in 1950s Manhattan. But living above her apartment, a peculiar cloaked man with a rare hair disorder piques Diane's curiosity and with his encouragement, her remarkable talent for capturing the extraordinary on film is revealed. Also with Robert Downey Jr., Ty Burrell, Harris Yulin and Jane Alexander. Directed by Steven Shainberg, inspired by the book Diane Arbus: A Biography by Patricia Bosworth, written by Erin Cressida Wilson. (R) (AC,AL,N).(n)

programme.title: A Prairie Home Companion
programme.desc: "Four stars...a lovely film" (Roger Ebert). Legendary director Robert Altman's final film before his death is a stirring recreation of Garrison Keillor's beloved radio show. Featuring an all-star cast along with Keillor and many of his amusing regulars, the film follows the events leading up to the final broadcast of the radio programwhich has been axed by its corporate owners. "Not since Woody Allen's Radio Days has anyone created such a cinematic Valentine to the wonderfully imaginative medium of radio" (Hollywood Reporter). Woody Harrelson, Tommy Lee Jones, Garrison Keillor, Kevin Kline, Lindsay Lohan, Virginia Madsen, John C. Reilly, Maya Rudolph, Meryl Streep, Lily Tomlin, Marylouise Burke, L.Q. Jones, Tim Russell and Sue Scott star. Directed by Robert Altman (Gosford Park); screenplay by Garrison Keillor; story by Garrison Keillor & Ken LaZebnik.(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth is ''brilliant'' (N.Y. Observer) in this chronicle of the complex relationship between famed literary editor Max Perkins, who discovered Ernest Hemingway and F. Scott Fitzgerald, and the eccentric novelist Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). Co-starring Nicole Kidman and Laura Linney, with Guy Pearce, Dominic West. Directed by Michael Grandage; screenplay by John Logan, based on the book by A. Scott Berg. (PG13) (AC,AL,BN).(n)

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: "Spectacular...serious-minded and well acted" (Seattle Times). Six months after the Japanese attack at Pearl Harbor, the United States Navy and a squad of intrepid fighter pilots take part in one of the most vital fights of World War II: the Battle of Midway. From the director of "Independence Day" comes this epic war picture that chronicles this ferocious battle that occurred from June 4-7, 1942. The stellar ensemble cast includes Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Luke Evans, Aaron Eckhart, Nick Jonas, Luke Kleintank, Darren Criss, Keean Johnson with Mandy Moore, Dennis Quaid and Woody Harrelson. Directed by Roland Emmerich; written by Wes Tooke.(n)

programme.title: Their Finest
programme.desc: As the Nazi Blitz rains down on Britain, a young woman plays an unlikely role in inspiring the nation when she takes a job as a scriptwriter on a major propaganda film. Gemma Arterton, Sam Claflin and a scene-stealing Bill Nighy head up the cast in this romantic comedy. "Four stars beautifully cast, intelligently written" (The Observer). Co-starring Jack Huston, Helen McCrory, Eddie Marsan, Jake Lacy, Rachael Stirling with Richard E. Grant. Directed by Lone Scherfig; screenplay by Gaby Chiappe, based on the novel "Their Finest Hour and a Half" by Lissa Evans.(n)

programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
programme.desc: From producer James Wan (''Saw,'' ''The Conjuring'') comes this intense exercise in horror that centers on a woman who drowned her kids in a jealous rage in 17th-century Mexico and now haunts families in 1970s Los Angeles, searching for children to replace her own. Starring Linda Cardellini, Raymond Cruz, Patricia Velasquez, Marisol Ramirez, Sean Patrick Thomas, Jaynee-Lynne Kinchen, Roman Christou. Directed by Michael Chaves; written by Mikki Daughtry & Tobias Iaconis.(n)

programme.title: Just Mercy
programme.desc: Michael B. Jordan stars as Harvard-educated attorney Bryan Stevenson, who goes to Alabama in the 1980s to defend the poor, and fights to prove the innocence of a death row inmate (Jamie Foxx). Rob Morgan, Tim Blake Nelson, Rafe Spall and Brie Larson co-star in this inspirational true story. Directed by Destin Daniel Cretton; written by Destin Daniel Cretton & Andrew Lanham, based on the book by Bryan Stevenson.(n)

programme.desc: Will and Lyra make a plan, unaware of the dangers or the cost involved.(n)

Robert Duvall, James Woods, Anne Heche, Eddie Griffin, Shawn Hatosy, Kimberly Elise and Ray Liotta co-star. Directed by Nick Cassavetes; written by James Kearns.(n)

programme.title: Euphoria: Trouble Don't Last Always
programme.desc: In the aftermath of being left by Jules at the train station and relapsing, Rue celebrates Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Euphoria: Trouble Don't Last Always
programme.desc: In the aftermath of being left by Jules at the train station and relapsing, Rue celebrates Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Baby God
programme.desc: Once hailed as a miracle worker, Dr. Quincy Fortier's secret is now out. Formerly a renowned Nevada fertility specialist, he has become best known for deceiving countless women struggling to conceive by using his own sperm--without their knowledge or consent--to impregnate them. Featuring intimate and revealing interviews with many of Fortier's children, the film takes a close, nuanced look at the lasting effects that Fortier's misdeeds have had--and will continue to have--on the women he victimized, as well as their children and generations to come. The result is a stunning expose of the egregious, once undetectable truths about Fortier's medical practice, as well as his alleged sexual abuse of family members.(n)

programme.title: Baby God

Formerly a renowned Nevada fertility specialist, he has become best known for deceiving countless women struggling to conceive by using his own sperm--without their knowledge or consent--to impregnate them.
